docs.lead_paragraph: People with eating disorders like anorexia are fighting insurers to pay for stays in residential treatment centers, an issue that is being considered by an appeals court in California.

headline.seo: Ruling Offers Hope to Eating Disorder Sufferers
headline.main: Eating Disorders a New Front in Insurance Fight
headline.print_headline: Eating Disorders a New Front in Insurance Fight

docs.abstract: Both sides are closely watching consequences of US Court of Appeals for Ninth Circuit decision, which ruled that insurers in California must pay for residential treatment for eating disorders and other mental illnesses under state's mental parity law; laws, also enacted in other states, generally require that coverage for mental disorders be equivalent to that for physical ailments, but parity can be difficult to define; Blue Shield of California, defendant in lawsuit, is seeking to have case reheard
docs.snippet: People with eating disorders like anorexia are fighting insurers to pay for stays in residential treatment centers, an issue that is being considered by an appeals court in California.

docs.lead_paragraph: Scientific discoveries can be serendipitous, and so it was when Jay L. Alberts, then a Parkinson's disease researcher at Emory University in Atlanta, mounted a tandem bike with Cathy Frazier, a Parkinson's patient. The two were riding the 2003 RAGBRAI bicycle tour across Iowa, hoping to raise awareness of the neurodegenerative disease and "show people with Parkinson's that you don't have to sit back and let the disease take over your life," Dr. Alberts said.

headline.main: What Parkinson's Teaches Us About the Brain

docs.abstract: Forced exercise eases symptoms in patients with Parkinson's disease and is raising intriguing questions about how intense exercise affects the brain in healthy people.
docs.snippet: Forced exercise eases symptoms in patients with Parkinson's disease and is raising intriguing questions about how intense exercise affects the brain in healthy people.

docs.lead_paragraph: An analysis in The Lancet showed that a prevention program in India worked better in some states than others.

headline.seo: AIDS Program’s Progress in India Is Uneven
headline.main: India: Gates Foundation’s AIDS Program in India Has Made Uneven Progress Over 8 Years
headline.print_headline: India: Gates Foundation’s AIDS Program in India Has Made Uneven Progress Over 8 Years

docs.abstract: Analysis published in journal The Lancet finds large and costly AIDS prevention program pioneered by Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation in India eight years ago has had mixed results. Analysis is authored by epidemiologists from India and the University of Washington.
docs.snippet: An analysis in The Lancet showed that a prevention program in India worked better in some states than others.

docs.lead_paragraph: A search of The Times database from the early 1920s until Freud’s death in 1939 yields nearly 300 references to him and almost 1,000 to psychoanalysis, first mentioned in the newspaper as “psychanalysis.”
docs.abstract: New York Times first mentioned Sigmund Freud on Sept 21, 1909, and his name has been referenced nearly 300 times since then.
docs.snippet: A search of The Times database from the early 1920s until Freud’s death in 1939 yields nearly 300 references to him and almost 1,000 to psychoanalysis, first mentioned in the newspaper as “psychanalysis.”

docs.lead_paragraph: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug can prevent people from being infected by H.I.V., but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug.

headline.seo: Questions Surround Effort to Prevent H.I.V. With Antiretroviral Drugs
headline.main: Questions on Tactic to Prevent H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: H.I.V. Drug Faces Trial And Raises Questions

docs.abstract: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug Truvada can prevent people from being infected by HIV, but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug and how it would affect other preventive measures.
docs.snippet: Three clinical trials have shown that an antiretroviral drug can prevent people from being infected by H.I.V., but it remains to be seen how faithfully uninfected patients would take the drug.

docs.lead_paragraph: "Active commutes" offer the satisfactions of a workout while the planet benefits.

headline.main: Hitting the Road to Get to Work, and Back
headline.print_headline: Hitting the Road to Get to Work, and Back

docs.snippet: "Active commutes" offer the satisfactions of a workout while the planet benefits.
